content: There is a new doc giving an overview of the consensus upgrade from Mainnet perspective. The doc is in active development and it would be great to get more eyes on it. Discussion will happen during the Merge Implementers call 1. Looking forward to your questions and comments, https://hackmd.io/@n0ble/ethereum_consensus_upgrade_mainnet_perspective

author: chat-bridge
content: <vbuterin> Added some comments

author: chat-bridge
content: <vbuterin> Hmm, I do think that we need to think much more carefully and explicitly about the transition *process* (ie. the first embedded block)

author: chat-bridge
content: <vbuterin> That's the biggest potential source of landmines imo

author: chat-bridge
content: <vbuterin> One possible landmine is the beacon chain reorging from a chain that has embedded application blocks to a chain that does not

author: chat-bridge
content: <vbuterin> That is why in my original proposal I took care to make the fork choice rule stateless

author: chat-bridge
content: <vbuterin> so it could swing back and forth between following the beacon chain and following max tot diff if needed

author: chat-bridge
content: <vbuterin> Whereas this doc seems to take "one way switch" route, which seems dangerous?

author: chat-bridge
content: <vbuterin> Or am I missing something?

author: chat-bridge
content: <vbuterin> Also, what are the requirements for what the first embedded block must point to as a parent?

author: chat-bridge
content: <vbuterin> (ie. the transition conditions)

author: chat-bridge
content: <vbuterin> I'm definitely happy with the new block format proposal!

author: chat-bridge
content: <vbuterin> And that thinking is being done on the sync process!

author: chat-bridge
content: <n0ble> One way switch doesn‚Äôt prevent re-orgs with changing of the last PoW block. If the first PoS block is orphaned the other one could be produced even with the different PoW block as a parent, then the application-layer will re-org to the latter one if it‚Äôs considered as valid and so force until network start making progress (re @vbuterin: Whereas this doc seems to take "one way switch" route, which seems dangerous?)

author: chat-bridge
content: <n0ble> Are you referring to the transition conditions, i.e. total difficulty? If yes, then this is just not specified in the doc because this is the consensus-layer responsibility. Though, I thing we should add this for clarity (re @vbuterin: Also, what are the requirements for what the first embedded block must point to as a parent?)

author: chat-bridge
content: <n0ble> definitely agree, need more details and potential edge cases to think through and document out (re @vbuterin: Hmm, I do think that we need to think much more carefully and explicitly about the transition *process* (ie. the first embedded block))
